I ran my tests with the 'java -verbose:class' flag which shows class loader=
 info.  It shows my classes being loaded by the VM's class loader.  From wh=
at I understand, JUnit uses it's own class loader in certain situations.  I=
'm wondering if it's a problem with JUnit's class loader.  

I'm running my=
 tests by creating a main method in my test class which creates a 
TestSuit=
e object and calls the run method on the suite.  In other words, I'm not us=
ing the TextRunner to run my tests.  I had the same problems with the TextR=
unner.

I'm also hardcoding the servialVersionUID in my classes.  The way t=
he serialVersionUID is calculated is by creating a hashcode based on the de=
finition of the class.  I'm making an educated guess here that it's somehow=
 getting an empty class definition which yields an ID of 0.  (As I said bef=
ore, I'm hard coding the ID so that also leads me to believe that somehow t=
he class def is not being loaded properly).

Very strange.
